overview_of_class: Since its beginnings, film has always been an important medium of societal self-reflection; for anyone interested in the history of the 20th century, it is an essential source of information about the discourses and topics that were virulent at a certain time. Besides (and maybe most importantly), it is a great art form, and German cinema has produced some of the quintessential masterworks of that field. The class is primarily focused on giving an overview of German (-language) film from the Weimar Republic on and providing the basic terms and concepts of film analysis. In addition to the canonical films everyone should know, there will be sections on the cinema of the "Third Reich", on West German mass-market films of the 1950s (western movies and "Heimatfilme"), and on East German cinema. In order to successfully participate in this class, you obviously have to be willing to watch a lot of movies which will be available on Canvas and/or screened on the big screen.
